did.unittitle: Stephen Robeson Miller research material on Kay Sage

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A circa 100 p. chronology of Sage's life (published as a book, along with Sage's unpublished one-act Surrealist Plays in 1995 and 2011); her medical history; an exhibition record; circa 40 letters from Sage to her father, her stepmother, and her half-sister, Cornelia Sage Walcott Mackin; letters to Miller from Sage's friends, family and colleagues; and correspondence, 1973-1983, related to Sage's work; transcripts of interviews conducted by Miller with people who knew Sage; Sage's cancelled checks; bibliographic references assembled by Miller; Miller's master's thesis, "The Art of Kay Sage," Boston University, l982; a catalog raisonne by Miller (to be published as a book by Prestel Verlag, New York, in 2018) including ca. 200 photos of Sage's works; photos of Christmas cards by Sage and Yves Tanguy; and 42 photos, 1898-ca. 1960, of Sage, her family and friends, and 12 photos of Sage's residence, 1957.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm rolls 2886-2888 available in Archives of American Art offices only.

altformavail.head: Reproduction Note
altformavail.p: Originals returned to the lender, Stephen Robeson Miller, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Art historian; Boston, Mass. Extensively researched Surrealist painter Kay Sage.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming by Stephen Robeson Miller, 1983.
